$370 feet
$the ball struck the LF pole and caromed back onto the field; the Tigers to argued that the ball was in play

$Lou Sleater went into a full windup with the bases loaded; Hank Bauer tried to steal 2B, realized his mistake, and headed back to 1B; Frank House threw to 1B and Earl Torgeson threw to 3B, allowing Bill Skowron to score before the Tigers could catch Bobby Richardson in a rundown for the third out
$upper bleachers over 400 foor mark
